description: left 3 panels show close image of bamboo plant; right 3 panels bamboo grove at top as a background with continuation at lower quarter of left panels
markings: undecifered inscription and two red stamps at UL corner
medium: Six-panel folding screen; ink on paper and gold leaf
text: Tsubaki Chinzan was a government official who became enamored with the painting modes of Chinese literati artists. He specialized in bird-and-flower themes and produced many delicately colored works in the "boneless" style (without ink outlines). As exemplified by this pair ot screens, however, some of Chizan's most elegant and evocative work was in pure ink. The right screen illustrates a grotto of epidendrum orchids--small unassuming plants which send forth a marvelous fragrance, just as bookish scholars "blossom." The left screen pictures bamboo, admired for its strength in strong winds, just as a scholar is resolute in the face of stupidity and ignorance.
title: Orchids and Bamboo (one of a pair)
